Submodules¶

pyplotgen.pyplotgen module¶

Author

Nicolas Strike

Date

Jan 2019

This file is the main driver for PyPlotGen. It handles the overall process of retrieving the user’s clubb and dictating the loading of files, generation of plots, and then the export of plots, though these processes are mostly carried out by other classes/files.

class pyplotgen.PyPlotGen(output_folder, clubb_folders=None, replace=False, les=False, cgbest=False, hoc=False, benchmark_only=False, nightly=False, zip=False, thin=False, no_legends=False, ensemble=False, plot_e3sm='', sam_folders=[''], wrf_folders=[''], cam_folders=[''], budget_moments=False, bu_morr=False, diff=None, show_alphabetic_id=False, time_height=False, animation=None, disable_multithreading=False)¶

Bases: object

Main class for the pyplotgen program. After processing the command line options in the main function, an instance of this class is created in __process_args__, passing all option parameters. Finally the run function of this class is the actual driver of the pyplotgen program, creating the CaseGallerySetup objects and calling their plot functions to generate the images and html output.

__benchmarkFilesNeeded__()¶

Returns true if the user requested to plot model output that needs to be downloaded

Returns

True if any of self.les or self.hoc or self.cgbest is True, else False

__caseNcFileExists__(list_of_src_folders, rel_filepath)¶

__copySetupFiles__()¶

Copies case setup files from the clubb folder(s) into the pyplotgen output folders.

Returns

None

__dataForCaseExists__(case_def)¶

Returns true if there’s an nc file for a given case name and any model that should be plotted.

Parameters

case_def – The case definition object

Returns

True if data exists, False if not

__dict__ = mappingproxy({'__module__': 'pyplotgen', '__doc__': '\n Main class for the pyplotgen program.\n After processing the command line options in the main function,\n an instance of this class is created in __process_args__, passing all option parameters.\n Finally the run function of this class is the actual driver of the pyplotgen program,\n creating the CaseGallerySetup objects and calling their plot functions to generate the images and html output.\n ', '__init__': <function PyPlotGen.__init__>, 'run': <function PyPlotGen.run>, '__extractNumCasesPlotted__': <function PyPlotGen.__extractNumCasesPlotted__>, '__plotCase__': <function PyPlotGen.__plotCase__>, '__dataForCaseExists__': <function PyPlotGen.__dataForCaseExists__>, '__caseNcFileExists__': <function PyPlotGen.__caseNcFileExists__>, '__copySetupFiles__': <function PyPlotGen.__copySetupFiles__>, '__benchmarkFilesNeeded__': <function PyPlotGen.__benchmarkFilesNeeded__>, '__downloadModelOutputs__': <function PyPlotGen.__downloadModelOutputs__>, '__dict__': <attribute '__dict__' of 'PyPlotGen' objects>, '__weakref__': <attribute '__weakref__' of 'PyPlotGen' objects>})¶
__downloadModelOutputs__()¶

Checks for model output in the folder specified under Case_definitions.BENCHMARK_OUTPUT_ROOT, e.g. sam benchmark runs, and if it doesn’t exist, downloads it. Supports: SAM, COAMPS, CLUBB

Returns

None

__extractNumCasesPlotted__(plotCaseDataArray)¶

The __plotCase__() function is often called via a pooling map. As such, the data returned from the pool map is an array of True/False values where each True represents a case being plotted and each False represents a case not being plotted. This function counts the number of True’s and retuns that.

Parameters

plotCaseDataArray – Array of True/False values

Returns

number of True’s in the given list.

__init__(output_folder, clubb_folders=None, replace=False, les=False, cgbest=False, hoc=False, benchmark_only=False, nightly=False, zip=False, thin=False, no_legends=False, ensemble=False, plot_e3sm='', sam_folders=[''], wrf_folders=[''], cam_folders=[''], budget_moments=False, bu_morr=False, diff=None, show_alphabetic_id=False, time_height=False, animation=None, disable_multithreading=False)¶

This creates an instance of PyPlotGen. Each parameter is a command line parameter passed in from the argparser below.

Parameters

  • output_folder – String containing the foldername into which the output files should be put.

  • clubb_folders – List of foldernames containing CLUBB netcdf files to be plotted. Pass a list of folders in with this option. These folders must contain the CLUBB nc files in the root directory, where each filename is the name of the case to be plotted with the CLUBB-specific suffixes: _zm, _zt E.g. name files dycoms2_rfo2_ds_zm.nc and dycoms2_rfo2_ds_zt.nc to plot the file’s data with that case’s setup.

  • replace – If False, an already existing outout folder will not be overwritten.

  • les – If True, plot LES dependent_data for comparison.

  • cgbest – If True, plot Chris Golaz Best Ever dependent_data for comparison.

  • hoc – If True, plot !HOC 12/17/2015 dependent_data for comparison.

  • benchmark_only – If True, autoplotting of CLUBB’s default output folder is shut off. So only benchmark output will be plotted.

  • nightly – Apply special parameters only relevant when running as part of a nightly test. This is currently limited to disabling case output if not all models have data for a given case. E.g. this prevents wrf plots from including cases that only have clubb plots and no wrf plots. Do not plot this with clubb-only plots, just plot clubb normally for clubb nightly tests.

  • zip – If True, output dependent_data into a compressed zip file. Not implemented.

  • thin – If True, plot using thin solid lines.

  • no_legends – If True, plots will not have legend boxes listing the line types.

  • ensemble – If True, plot ensemble tuner runs. Not implemented.

  • plot_e3sm – Plot E3SM dependent_data for comparison. This parameter works exactly like the clubb_folders parameter, except E3SM uses only one nc file.

  • sam_folders – Plot SAM dependent_data for comparison. This parameter works exactly like the clubb_folders parameter, except SAM uses only one nc file.

  • wrf_folders – Plot WRF dependent_data for comparison. This parameter works exactly like the clubb_folders parameter, except WRF uses the following nc files: _zm, _zt, and _sfc

  • cam_folders – Plot CAM dependent_data for comparison. This parameter works exactly like the clubb_folders parameter, except CAM uses only one nc file. (CHECK!)

  • budget_moments – If True, plot all defined budgets of moments.

  • bu_morr – For morrison microphysics: If True, break microphysical source terms into component processes. Not implemented.

  • diff – Plot the difference between two clubb folders. (MORE DESCRIPTION)

  • show_alphabetic_id – If True, add an identifying character to the top right of a panel.

  • time_height – If True, plot time-height (contourf) plots instead of profile-like plots

  • animation – If True, create time animations instead of time-averaged plots (works with profile and budget plots) (Not yet implemented).

__module__ = 'pyplotgen'¶
__plotCase__(case_def)¶

Plots the given case. Pulled out into it’s own function to help move towards multithreading :param case_def: :return: True if case was plotted, False if case was not plotted

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

run()¶

Main driver of the pyplotgen program executing the following steps: - Download benchmark files if needed - Loop through cases listed in Case_definitions.ALL_CASES - Create instances of these cases - Call plot function on the instances - Create output folder - Generate html page containing plots

Returns

None

pyplotgen.__processArguments__()¶

This method takes arguments in from the command line and feeds them into a PyPlotGen object

Returns

A PyPlotGen object containing the parameters as given from the commandline.

pyplotgen.__trimTrailingSlash__(args)¶

Takes in a list filepaths and removes any trailing /’s

Parameters

arg – list of string file paths

Returns

list of filepaths with trailing /’s removed

Module contents¶

Author

Nicolas Strike

Date

Jan 2019

This file is the main driver for PyPlotGen. It handles the overall process of retrieving the user’s clubb and dictating the loading of files, generation of plots, and then the export of plots, though these processes are mostly carried out by other classes/files.

class pyplotgen.PyPlotGen(output_folder, clubb_folders=None, replace=False, les=False, cgbest=False, hoc=False, benchmark_only=False, nightly=False, zip=False, thin=False, no_legends=False, ensemble=False, plot_e3sm='', sam_folders=[''], wrf_folders=[''], cam_folders=[''], budget_moments=False, bu_morr=False, diff=None, show_alphabetic_id=False, time_height=False, animation=None, disable_multithreading=False)¶

Bases: object

Main class for the pyplotgen program. After processing the command line options in the main function, an instance of this class is created in __process_args__, passing all option parameters. Finally the run function of this class is the actual driver of the pyplotgen program, creating the CaseGallerySetup objects and calling their plot functions to generate the images and html output.

__benchmarkFilesNeeded__()¶

Returns true if the user requested to plot model output that needs to be downloaded

Returns

True if any of self.les or self.hoc or self.cgbest is True, else False

Checks for model output in the folder specified under Case_definitions.BENCHMARK_OUTPUT_ROOT, e.g. sam benchmark runs, and if it doesn’t exist, downloads it. Supports: SAM, COAMPS, CLUBB

__extractNumCasesPlotted__(plotCaseDataArray)¶

The __plotCase__() function is often called via a pooling map. As such, the data returned from the pool map is an array of True/False values where each True represents a case being plotted and each False represents a case not being plotted. This function counts the number of True’s and retuns that.

Parameters

plotCaseDataArray – Array of True/False values

Returns

number of True’s in the given list.

__init__(output_folder, clubb_folders=None, replace=False, les=False, cgbest=False, hoc=False, benchmark_only=False, nightly=False, zip=False, thin=False, no_legends=False, ensemble=False, plot_e3sm='', sam_folders=[''], wrf_folders=[''], cam_folders=[''], budget_moments=False, bu_morr=False, diff=None, show_alphabetic_id=False, time_height=False, animation=None, disable_multithreading=False)¶

This creates an instance of PyPlotGen. Each parameter is a command line parameter passed in from the argparser below.

Parameters

  • output_folder – String containing the foldername into which the output files should be put.

  • clubb_folders – List of foldernames containing CLUBB netcdf files to be plotted. Pass a list of folders in with this option. These folders must contain the CLUBB nc files in the root directory, where each filename is the name of the case to be plotted with the CLUBB-specific suffixes: _zm, _zt E.g. name files dycoms2_rfo2_ds_zm.nc and dycoms2_rfo2_ds_zt.nc to plot the file’s data with that case’s setup.

  • replace – If False, an already existing outout folder will not be overwritten.

  • les – If True, plot LES dependent_data for comparison.

  • cgbest – If True, plot Chris Golaz Best Ever dependent_data for comparison.

  • hoc – If True, plot !HOC 12/17/2015 dependent_data for comparison.

  • benchmark_only – If True, autoplotting of CLUBB’s default output folder is shut off. So only benchmark output will be plotted.

  • nightly – Apply special parameters only relevant when running as part of a nightly test. This is currently limited to disabling case output if not all models have data for a given case. E.g. this prevents wrf plots from including cases that only have clubb plots and no wrf plots. Do not plot this with clubb-only plots, just plot clubb normally for clubb nightly tests.

  • zip – If True, output dependent_data into a compressed zip file. Not implemented.

  • thin – If True, plot using thin solid lines.

  • no_legends – If True, plots will not have legend boxes listing the line types.

  • ensemble – If True, plot ensemble tuner runs. Not implemented.

  • plot_e3sm – Plot E3SM dependent_data for comparison. This parameter works exactly like the clubb_folders parameter, except E3SM uses only one nc file.

  • sam_folders – Plot SAM dependent_data for comparison. This parameter works exactly like the clubb_folders parameter, except SAM uses only one nc file.

  • wrf_folders – Plot WRF dependent_data for comparison. This parameter works exactly like the clubb_folders parameter, except WRF uses the following nc files: _zm, _zt, and _sfc

  • cam_folders – Plot CAM dependent_data for comparison. This parameter works exactly like the clubb_folders parameter, except CAM uses only one nc file. (CHECK!)

  • budget_moments – If True, plot all defined budgets of moments.

  • bu_morr – For morrison microphysics: If True, break microphysical source terms into component processes. Not implemented.

  • diff – Plot the difference between two clubb folders. (MORE DESCRIPTION)

  • show_alphabetic_id – If True, add an identifying character to the top right of a panel.

  • time_height – If True, plot time-height (contourf) plots instead of profile-like plots

  • animation – If True, create time animations instead of time-averaged plots (works with profile and budget plots) (Not yet implemented).
